channel.title: Comments on: Success! Firefox OS 1.4 built and running on ZTE Open

item.title: By: Pascal
item.dc:creator: Pascal
item.description: Thank you very much! This did the trick indeed. And saved my night :)
item.content:encoded: Thank you very much! This did the trick indeed. And saved my night ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: Florian
item.dc:creator: Florian
item.description:
Hi all, i've had the same problem.
cp: cannot stat â€˜../../../backup-flame/system/lib/modules/ath6kl-3.5/ath6kl_sdio.koâ€™: No such file or directory Failed to pull ath6kl_sdio.ko. Giving up.
The file seems to be missing, so the build backup won't be able to find it. My solution was to simply comment out the matching line in device/t2m/flame/extract-files.sh line 186: #copy_files "$COMMON_WIFI_VOLANS" "system/lib/modules/ath6kl-3.5" "wifi"
So build backup won't look for the file. Afterwards build works fine. I don't think this file is actually neccessary as wifi works with my build too. ;)
item.content:encoded:
Hi all, i’ve had the same problem.

cp: cannot stat â€˜../../../backup-flame/system/lib/modules/ath6kl-3.5/ath6kl_sdio.koâ€™: No such file or directory
Failed to pull ath6kl_sdio.ko. Giving up.

The file seems to be missing, so the build backup won’t be able to find it. My solution was to simply comment out the matching line in
device/t2m/flame/extract-files.sh
line 186:
#copy_files “$COMMON_WIFI_VOLANS” “system/lib/modules/ath6kl-3.5” “wifi”

So build backup won’t look for the file.
Afterwards build works fine. I don’t think this file is actually neccessary as wifi works with my build too. ðŸ˜‰

item.title: By: Steve
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description: Actually I'm confused, the link to "the FirefoxOS 1.2 provided by ZTE" does seem to work. To build 2.1 just change 'BRANCH=v1.4' to BRANCH=v2.1" in the build instructions. Note how ever at some point the mozilla builds change to use Android Lollipop and not KitKat as provided by ZTE - so won't work.
item.content:encoded: Actually I’m confused, the link to “the FirefoxOS 1.2 provided by ZTE” does seem to work. To build 2.1 just change ‘BRANCH=v1.4’ to BRANCH=v2.1″ in the build instructions. Note how ever at some point the mozilla builds change to use Android Lollipop and not KitKat as provided by ZTE – so won’t work.

item.title: By: Steve
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description: Sorry Zak, I had a good search but no luck. I can only suggest you contact ZTE
item.content:encoded: Sorry Zak, I had a good search but no luck. I can only suggest you contact ZTE

item.title: By: Zack May
item.dc:creator: Zack May
item.description: Hi i recently bought a ZTE open a while back and i'm having a hard time upgrading to the new OS versions like 1.4 or the lastest 2.1. say i was hoping if you could share the build for the 1.4 because i try clicking on the link you provided and it doesn't seem to work. say would you do a tutorial on upgrading to 2.1? please and thank you so much!
item.content:encoded: Hi i recently bought a ZTE open a while back and i’m having a hard time upgrading to the new OS versions like 1.4 or the lastest 2.1. say i was hoping if you could share the build for the 1.4 because i try clicking on the link you provided and it doesn’t seem to work. say would you do a tutorial on upgrading to 2.1? please and thank you so much!

item.title: By: Zack May
item.dc:creator: Zack May
item.description: Hi I'm interested in updating the ZTE open I bought a while back and I was wondering if by chance you could probably email me the build you had used in the tutorial? Please? Its no longer accessible by conventional means:(
item.content:encoded: Hi I’m interested in updating the ZTE open I bought a while back and I was wondering if by chance you could probably email me the build you had used in the tutorial? Please? Its no longer accessible by conventional means:(

item.title: By: Steve
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description: Sorry. No. I'm no clear why you want to use flame builds for the ZTE. Don't mix them. Try #B2G on IRC for support
item.content:encoded: Sorry. No. I’m no clear why you want to use flame builds for the ZTE. Don’t mix them. Try #B2G on IRC for support

item.title: By: Chunyan
item.dc:creator: Chunyan
item.description: I am getting the same error when building for ZTE Open C using Flame reference and a manifest associated with ZTE Open C. Did you find out a solution? Thanks.
item.content:encoded: I am getting the same error when building for ZTE Open C using Flame reference and a manifest associated with ZTE Open C. Did you find out a solution? Thanks.

item.title: By: Steve
item.dc:creator: Steve
item.description: My understanding is the Open C is much better supported by the ZTE. You don;t say what file you can't find but try the <a href="http://www.ztedevices.com/support/smart_phone/46d40c52-bed4-4cdc-9df9-01719cdf0a70.html?type=software" rel="nofollow">ZTE support pages</a>, <a href="http://en.comebuy.com/developer-firefox-os-open-c.html://" rel="nofollow">this one</a> or <a href="https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/Firefox_OS/Developer_phone_guide/ZTE_OPEN_C" rel="nofollow">MDN page</a>
item.content:encoded: My understanding is the Open C is much better supported by the ZTE. You don;t say what file you can’t find but try the ZTE support pages, this one or MDN page
